Robust Kalman filtering and sensitivity equations¶

class pysip.state_estimator.kalman_qr.Kalman_QR[source]¶

Square-root Kalman filter and sensitivity equations

References

Maria V. Kulikova, Julia Tsyganova, A unified square-root approach for the score and Fisher information matrix computation in linear dynamic systems. Mathematics and Computers in Simulation 119: 128-141 (2016)

dlog_likelihood(ssm, dssm, index, u, u1, y)[source]¶

Evaluate the gradient of the negative log-likelihood

Parameters

  • ssm (NamedTuple) – Discrete state-space model

  • dssm (NamedTuple) – Discrete jacobian state-space model

  • index (ndarray) – Index of unique time steps

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • u1 (ndarray) – Forward finite difference of the input data

  • y (ndarray) – Output data

Return type

Tuple[float, ndarray]

Returns

2-element tuple containing

  • loglik: Negative log-likelihood

  • gradient: Gradient of the negative log-likelihood

dpredict(Ad, dAd, B0d, dB0d, B1d, dB1d, Qd, dQd, x, dx, P, dP, u, u1)[source]¶

Derivative state prediction

Parameters

  • Ad (ndarray) – State matrix

  • dAd (ndarray) – Jacobian state matrix

  • B0d (ndarray) – Input matrix (zero order hold)

  • dB0d (ndarray) – Jacobian input matrix (zero order hold)

  • B1d (ndarray) – Input matrix (first order hold)

  • dB1d (ndarray) – Jacobian input matrix (first order hold)

  • Qd (ndarray) – Process noise covariance matrix

  • dQd (ndarray) – Jacobian process noise covariance matrix

  • x (ndarray) – State mean

  • dx (ndarray) – Jacobian state mean

  • P (ndarray) – State deviation

  • dP (ndarray) – Jacobian state deviation

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • u1 (ndarray) – Forward finite difference of the input data

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray]

Returns

4-element tuple containing

  • x: Prior state mean

  • dx: Derivative prior state mean

  • P: Prior state deviation

  • dP: Derivative prior state deviation

dupdate(C, dC, D, dD, R, dR, x, dx, P, dP, u, y)[source]¶

Derivative state update

Parameters

  • C (ndarray) – Output matrix

  • dC (ndarray) – Jacobian output matrix

  • D (ndarray) – Feedthrough matrix

  • dD (ndarray) – Jacobian feedthrough matrix

  • R (ndarray) – Measurement deviation matrix

  • dR (ndarray) – Jacobian measurement deviation matrix

  • x (ndarray) – State mean

  • dx (ndarray) – Jacobian state mean

  • P (ndarray) – State deviation

  • dP (ndarray) – Jacobian state deviation

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • y (ndarray) – Output data

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray]

Returns

8-element tuple containing

  • x: Filtered state mean

  • dx: Derivative filtered state mean

  • P: Filtered state deviation

  • dP: Derivative filtered state deviation

  • e: Standardized residulas

  • de: Derivative standardized residulas

  • S: Residuals deviation

  • dS: Derivative residuals deviation

filtering(ssm, index, u, u1, y, x0=None, P0=None)[source]¶

Compute the filtered state distribution

Parameters

  • ssm (NamedTuple) – Discrete state-space model

  • index (ndarray) – Index of unique time steps

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • u1 (ndarray) – Forward finite difference of the input data

  • y (ndarray) – Output data

  • x0 (Optional[ndarray]) – Inital state mean different from ssm

  • P0 (Optional[ndarray]) – Inital state deviation different from ssm

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray]

Returns

4-element tuple containing

  • xf: Filtered state mean

  • Pf: Filtered state covariance

  • res: Standardized residuals

  • dev_res: Residuals deviation

log_likelihood(ssm, index, u, u1, y, point_wise=False)[source]¶

Evaluate the negative log-likelihood

Parameters

  • ssm (NamedTuple) – Discrete state-space model

  • index (ndarray) – Index of unique time steps

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • u1 (ndarray) – Forward finite difference of the input data

  • y (ndarray) – Output data

  • point_wise (bool) – Return the log-likelihood evaluated point-wise

Returns

Negative log-likelihood

Return type

loglik

predict(Ad, B0d, B1d, Qd, x, P, u, u1)[source]¶

State prediction

Parameters

  • Ad (ndarray) – State matrix

  • B0d (ndarray) – Input matrix (zero order hold)

  • B1d (ndarray) – Input matrix (first order hold)

  • Qd (ndarray) – Process noise covariance matrix

  • x (ndarray) – State mean

  • P (ndarray) – State deviation

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • u1 (ndarray) – Forward finite difference of the input data

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Returns

2-element tuple containing

  • x: Prior state mean

  • P: Prior state deviation

simulate(ssm, index, u, u1, x0=None)[source]¶

Stochastic output simulation

Parameters

  • ssm (NamedTuple) – Discrete state-space model

  • index (ndarray) – Index of unique time steps

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • u1 (ndarray) – Forward finite difference of the input data

  • x0 (Optional[ndarray]) – Inital state mean different from ssm

Returns

Simulated output

Return type

y

simulate_output(ssm, index, u, u1, y, x0=None, P0=None)[source]¶

Compute the filtered output distribution with the Kalman filter

Parameters

  • ssm (NamedTuple) – Discrete state-space model

  • index (ndarray) – Index of unique time steps

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • u1 (ndarray) – Forward finite difference of the input data

  • y (ndarray) – Output data

  • x0 (Optional[ndarray]) – Inital state mean different from ssm

  • P0 (Optional[ndarray]) – Inital state deviation different from ssm

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Returns

2-element tuple containing

  • ym: Filtered output mean

  • ysd: Filtered output standard deviation

smoothing(ssm, index, u, u1, y, x0=None, P0=None)[source]¶

Compute the smoothed state distribution Rauch-Tung-Striebel smoother

Parameters

  • ssm (NamedTuple) – Discrete state-space model

  • index (array) – Index of unique time steps

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • u1 (ndarray) – Forward finite difference of the input data

  • y (ndarray) – Output data

  • x0 (Optional[ndarray]) – Inital state mean different from ssm

  • P0 (Optional[ndarray]) – Inital state deviation different from ssm

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Returns

2-element tuple containing

  • xs: Smoothed state mean

  • Ps: Smoothed state covariance

update(C, D, R, x, P, u, y)[source]¶

State update

Parameters

  • C (ndarray) – Output matrix

  • D (ndarray) – Feedthrough matrix

  • R (ndarray) – Measurement deviation matrix

  • x (ndarray) – State mean

  • P (ndarray) – State deviation

  • u (ndarray) – Input data

  • y (ndarray) – Output data

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray]

Returns

4-element tuple containing

  • x: Filtered state mean

  • P: Filtered state deviation

  • e: Standardized residulas

  • S: Residuals deviation
